thread.title: Buckley: With Super Bowl berth, nowhere left for commissioner Roger Goodell to hide from Patriots
thread.title_full: Buckley: With Super Bowl berth, nowhere left for commissioner Roger Goodell to hide from Patriots

author: Steve Buckley
title: Buckley: With Super Bowl berth, nowhere left for commissioner Roger Goodell to hide from Patriots

organizations.name: matt stone credit: nancy lane new england patriots

text: Steve Buckley Monday, January 23, 2017 Credit: Matt Stone NE Patriots owner Robert Kraft holds up the Lamar Hunt AFC Championship trophy as quarterback Tom Brady and Jonathan Kraft look on after the AFC Championship against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Christopher Evans New England Patriots wide receiver Chris Hogan (15) celebrates after scoring a touchdown past Pittsburgh Steelers free safety Mike Mitchell during the second quarter of the NFL football NFC championship game at Gillette Stadium in Foxboro on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff photo by Christopher Evans Credit: Matt West New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady celebrates his second quarter touchdown pass to wide receiver Chris Hogan with running back LeGarrette Blount in the AFC Championship game against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West New England Patriots running back LeGarrette Blount celebrates, bringing the AFC Championship trophy to the crowd game after defeating Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Christopher Evans New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady waves to the crowd while celebrating the Patriots' AFC championship win over the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium in Foxboro on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff photo by Christopher Evans Credit: Christopher Evans New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick, left, and New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady and New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski celebrate after the Patriots defeated the Pittsburgh Steelers during the NFL football AFC championship game at Gillette Stadium in Foxboro on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff photo by Christopher Evans Credit: Nancy Lane Tom Brady and head coach Bill Belichick celebrate with the AFC championship trophy. New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt Stone New England Patriots cornerback Logan Ryan keeps Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Cobi Hamilton from scoring in the end zone during the fourth quarter of the AFC Championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Christopher Evans New England Patriots cornerback Logan Ryan, left, and New England Patriots cornerback Eric Rowe celebrate Rowe intercepted a pass by Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger during the fourth quarter of the NFL football AFC championship game at Gillette Stadium in Foxboro on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff photo by Christopher Evans Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots tight end Martellus Bennett celebrates with the cheerleaders after the win. New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt Stone New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady celebrates wide receiver Chris Hogan's touchdown as he runs with running back LeGarrette Blount during the second quarter of the AFC Championship against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Nancy Lane Tom Brady reacts after a touchdown during the third quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Nancy Lane |p12 waves to the crowd after receiving the AFC Championship trophy with head coach Bill Belichick after the win. New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt Stone NE Patriots owner Robert Kraft holds up the Lamar Hunt AFC Championship trophy as quarterback Tom Brady and Jonathan Kraft look on after the AFC Championship against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady lobs the ball to Chris Hogan during the second quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Nancy Lane Kyle Van Noy and Barkevious Mingo celebrate the Pats fumble recovery by Rob Ninkovich during the third quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt West New England Patriots cornerback Logan Ryan keeps Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Cobi Hamilton fro m making a fourth quarter catch in the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady throws to wide receiver Chris Hogan on a successful flea flicker in the second quarter against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West New England Patriots strong safety Patrick Chung signals incomplete after shutting down Pittsburgh Steelers tight end Jesse James in the third quarter of the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots wide receiver Danny Amendola runs up field before being hauled down by Pittsburgh Steelers nose tackle Dan McCullers-Sanders during the first quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman gets past Pittsburgh Steelers cornerback Artie Burns during the first quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots cornerback Eric Rowe celebrates his interception with Logan Ryan and Dont'a Hightower as Steelers tackle Alejandro Villanueva and tackle Marcus Gilbert walk off the field during the fourth quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt Stone Patriots owner Robert Kraft shakes hands with wide receiver Danny Amendola after winning the AFC Championship against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady celebrates after LeGarrette Blount's touchdown during the third quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt Stone Fans celebrate the Patriots win during the fourth quarter of the AFC Championship against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Nancy Lane New England Patriots cornerback Malcolm Butler hauls down Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Antonio Brown during the fourth quarter of the New England Patriots game against the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Nancy Lane Credit: Matt Stone Patriots fans hold a anti Roger Goodell sign during the third quarter of the AFC Championship against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Matt Stone New England Patriots strong safety Patrick Chung keeps Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams from scoring during the second quarter of the AFC Championship at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Staff photo by Matt Stone Credit: Matt West New England Patriots offensive linemen celebrate victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West FANS OF New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady hold up TB12 signs at the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West A fan wears his game face at the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West New England Patriots nose tackle Vincent Valentine stops Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams for a 3 yard loss on 2nd and goal in the second quarter of the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Matt West New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady smiles as he chats with referee Terry McAulay (77) during the second quarter of the AFC Championship game at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, January 22, 2017. Staff Photo by Matt West Credit: Christopher Evans New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick, left, and New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady celebrate after the Patriots defeated the Pittsburgh Steelers during the NFL football AFC championship game at Gillette Stadium in Foxboro on Sunday, January 22, 2017.
